channel.title: Uid
channel.description:
So, I know how ARGA now pops the UID value off the stack and pushes in their own, but my question is, how do they do that? Do they pop the Ljava/lang/String; "uid.dat" and push in "uid_bot_2.dat" etc.?
hulp plz!

item.title: Uid
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you would have to do that upon client load, as the UID is loaded on startup.

Read full topic

item.title: Uid
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Trying is the best way of finding out

Read full topic

item.title: Uid

Okay, another question. Will it work if I replace the field with the value of “uid.dat” with “bot_2s_UID.dat” for example
[/quote]How will it not work?[/quote]
So I’ll try it?

Read full topic

item.title: Uid
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

i just use reflection to set the value of the uid field, field.setInt(value)
right before login.

which is when jagex requests it

Read full topic

item.title: Uid
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:120061”]i thought when they said that, they used the actual value

so after it reads the value, it will be floating on the stack, pop it, stick your own in[/quote]
So, I should just altogether delete the instructions that write the UID and everytime the server requests the UID give it that value?

Read full topic
